{
  "Allegations" : "Customer inquired to the RR about the feasibility of transferring her two fixed annuities into her Variable Annuity (VA).  After the RR informed the customer that it was possible, the customer contacted the insurance company and liquidated her policies, with the proceeds going into her VA. Thus, causing a taxable event.  The RR neglected to inform the customer that her request should have been processed as a 1035 Exchange to avoid creating a taxable event.",
  "Damage Amount Requested" : "$9,978.00",
  "Settlement Amount" : "$1,625.00",
  "DisplayAAOLinkIfExists" : "N",

  "Broker Comment" : "The RR filed an Errors & Omissions (E&O) claim with his insurance carrier. The customer declined the E&O settlement and elected to resolve the matter with the IRS, reversing the tax liability. On June 9, 2017, the customer withdrew her request for taxes incurred and the difference in net social security benefits. The Firm settled the complaint by reimbursing the customer for the additional tax advice and filing an amended 2015 tax return. In addition, the customer accepted a settlement from the Firm for the time taken to resolve the matter on her own."
}
